ul.li: Each of the foldersunder 'thecontent' are corresponding to pages in a website.

Each of the pages have a name and shorttitle
name (which is found under attributes, onthepanel to the right) is the name of the page while navigating through the website
shorttitle - is the title of the page visible in the navigation

Each pagehas a few choices under attributes:
design: 3 designs to choose from. Design with sidebar automatically displaying a twitter feed if you have a twitter handle entered in settings/event/twitter-handle
If you are applying 'standard-sidebar' design, you can insert html in a page and set 'show-in' to 'related1' and add some related content in there
show-in-menu: yes/no based on if you want a page displayed in the navigation bar
index: should this page/content be indexed by a search engine such as Google

li.p: Every page has a content area which you have full control over. Here is an overview of the icons at the top of the WYSIWYGeditor:
If you need to add on any subpages, right click on the root page and add new pages.
Preview changes by clicking on the 'preview' button on the right sidebar
When ready to take your changes live to yourwebpage, click on the 'Publish' button
NOTE: contact Palomino if you need assistance with taking your webpage live to your domain.

html.p: Every little piece of content is editable on this webpage. Following are few highlights to get you started.
There are few options under this section.

ul.li: You can set the website colour scheme
Add in the title of the event - this will show on the top of the home page bannerimage
Select the location that your event istaking place in, which will then switch out an appropriate skyline banner image
Filling in Twitter information will trigger to show your feed on a page with a sidebar (e.g.agenda)

html.p: Home has 4 sections that are editable.
NOTE: Please do not change the names of these items as it is required to render on the home page layout and unique styling is also applied based on the names.
Expand each layer and you will beable to edit content and its icon within this editable node. Icons can be chosen from a list of FontAwesome Icons.

You have an option to also add in an image, instead of an icon as well. Right click on the 'blockitem' and insert 'image'. You are also allowed to insert as many 'blockitem's as you wantand the layout will automatically adjust based on how many items you have.
You may notice there is no place to edit the news widget on home page. This widget is populated from news list from here. You can edit any content related to news under that page.

Speakers page has a list node that you are able to use to organize all the speakers attending the event. Edit this table as you would edit an excel sheet. Also, use attributes to organize it in a way that is appropriate for your event.
Similar to speakers page, news is also kept in an editable and friendly table. Use this table to enter all your news items and use attributes to control the way news appears on the webpage.
NOTE:do not change the name of this list node as the home page news widget is using this exact name to populate the items on that page.
Under page 'common' you are able to edit logo and footer content which appear on all pages. This page is hidden from navigation.
